## types and classes

###types

```{r}
typeof(1.5)
typeof("toto")
typeof(TRUE)
typeof(1L)
typeof(1)
typeof(typeof)
typeof(list())
```
###classes


```{r}
data(iris)
typeof(iris)
class(iris)
```

##vectors

many things in R are vectores (and most of the other thing are listed)
a vector=collection of values of the same type (possibily a single value)

```{r}
x<-15.25
length(x) ##all vectors have a length
x(1)
```

```{r}
y<-c(1,-2,45,1.5,-1e-10)
y
typeof(y)
y[2]
length(y)
```
```{r}
c(x,y) #concatenation of vectors
```


###character vectors

this is not R strenght 

```{r}
z<-"Alice"
length(z)
```

salvation comes from the 'stringer' package


```{r}
library(stringr)
```

```{r}
str_length(z)
```
